title: Accessing d-d Excitations Around Misfit Dislocations in Strongly Correlated NiO Thin Films Using High Energy-Resolution EELS
content: Quantum materials are in the center of academic research due to their potential on resolving the ever-increasing demand in energy-efficient and high-speed microelectronic devices. In that respect, transition metal (TM) oxides, for which the partially filled d shell of the TM element leads to a wide range of unusual properties, are of particular interest. Their properties could in principle be tuned with the controlled interplay of several degrees of freedom like lattice, orbital, charge, and spin. Among the plethora of candidate compounds under investigation, nickel oxide (NiO) has become a major focus since the experimental evidence of excitonic excitations involving Ni d electrons [1, 2].
